marketNews.title: üõ¢Ô∏è Minyak +3%, Indikasi Oversold & Peningkatan Permintaan
marketNews.content: Brent crude futures for the July 2025 contract rose 3.1% to $62.15 per barrel at the close of trade on Tuesday, May 6, after a sharp sell-off driven by concerns of oversupply from the OPEC+ production increase scheduled for June 2025, which had pushed Brent down to $60.23 per barrel on Monday, May 5, marking the lowest level since February 2021. The price rebound on Tuesday was likely triggered by trader buying as the market entered an oversold technical territory. The rally was also supported by indications of higher demand from China and Europe, a decline in U.S. crude inventories, and heightened geopolitical tension in the Middle East following an Israeli strike on a major airport in Yemen. Reuters reported that Chinese consumer sentiment strengthened after consumer spending during the May Day holiday rose 8% YoY. The May Day holiday is one of the longest holidays in China and is often used as a consumer-confidence gauge. Meanwhile, LSEG I/B/E/S data project European companies to post a net profit growth of +0.4% YoY in 1Q25, up from a prior estimate of ‚Äì1.7% YoY and the ‚Äì3.5% YoY estimate after the Trump-tariff announcement. Analysts surveyed by Reuters expect U.S. crude inventories for the week ending May 2 to fall by 800,000 barrels; if realised, this would be the first two-week consecutive draw since January 2025. Following this news, several oil-related stocks and service providers rose on Wednesday, May 7, with $MEDC up 1.44%, $ENRG up 5.15%, $ELSA up 0.85%, $WINS up 1.68% and $LEAD up 2.3%.

marketNews.title: Toyota acquires 40% of PT Astra Digital Mobil for US$120 million
marketNews.content: The section titled ‚Äúüöó Toyota Akuisisi 40% Saham Anak Usaha ASII Rp2 T‚Äù reports that the Managing Director of Astra International, Djony Bunarto Tjondro, said the regional Toyota entity Toyota Motor Asia (Singapore) Pte. Ltd. has acquired 40% of PT Astra Digital Mobil through a combination of new share issuance and purchase of existing shares, amounting to a total of US$120 million (approximately IDR 2 trillion). Djony said the transaction is part of the company‚Äôs long-term strategy to develop a sustainable business portfolio. PT Astra Digital Mobil operates the OLX classified-ads platform and the online-to-offline used-car network OLXmobbi. After the transaction, ASII remains the controlling shareholder with a 60% stake.

marketNews.title: Grab pursues acquisition of GoTo Gojek Tokopedia
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB) is seeking to reach a deal to acquire GoTo Gojek Tokopedia in Q2 2025. Reuters said Grab has hired advisers for the transaction, which remains subject to financing conditions under discussion with banks. Grab and GoTo declined to comment. In March 2025 Bloomberg reported that Grab was seeking a loan of up to US$2 billion to fund the potential GoTo takeover, which is rumored to be valued at more than US$7 billion.

marketNews.title: Aster Chemicals to acquire Chevron Phillips Singapore Chemicals
marketNews.content: Aster Chemicals and Energy ‚Äì a joint venture between Chandra Asri Pacific and Glencore ‚Äì will acquire Chevron Phillips Singapore Chemicals through its affiliate Chandra Asri Capital, according to statements from both companies on Wednesday, May 7. The transaction value was not disclosed. Chevron Phillips Singapore Chemicals currently operates a 400,000-tonne-per-year polyethylene plant in Jurong, Singapore. In April 2025 Aster Chemicals and Energy also completed the acquisition of a refinery and downstream assets owned by Shell in Singapore.

marketNews.title: Barito Pacific denies IPO plans for PT Griya Idola
marketNews.content: Barito Pacific clarified in a filing to the IDX that the company has no plan to conduct an IPO for its subsidiary PT Griya Idola, responding to rumors spread by an Instagram content creator that the subsidiary would go public.

marketNews.title: ANTM to expand into jewellery and custom-product segments
marketNews.content: Aneka Tambang announced plans to add business activities targeting the jewellery, custom-product and other precious-metal laboratory ware segments. The plan will be discussed at the shareholders‚Äô meeting on 12 June 2025.

marketNews.title: SMGR denies divestiture of Semen Baturaja to UltraTech
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that rumors of Semen Indonesia divesting its Semen Baturaja subsidiary ($SMBR) to Indian cement maker UltraTech Cement Ltd. were addressed by SMBR‚Äôs corporate secretary, who said no discussions have taken place with UltraTech.

marketNews.title: First Resources completes 91.17% acquisition of Austindo Nusantara Jaya
marketNews.content: First Resources Ltd. completed the acquisition of approximately 91.17% of Austindo Nusantara Jaya at a price of IDR 1,813 per share, for a total transaction value of IDR 5.5 trillion. Following the deal, First Resources becomes the new controlling shareholder of ANJT and will conduct a mandatory tender offer. The transaction had been announced on 18 March 2025.

marketNews.title: PRDA announces up to IDR 200 billion share buy-back
marketNews.content: Prodia Widyahusada plans a share buy-back programme with a funding allocation of up to IDR 200 billion between 8 May and 7 August 2025. The company said the buy-back does not require a shareholders‚Äô meeting, as the Financial Services Authority (OJK) has relaxed the requirement.

marketNews.title: Cakra Bhakti Para Putra raises stake in ISSP to 56.07%
marketNews.content: The controlling shareholder of Steel Pipe Industry of Indonesia, PT Cakra Bhakti Para Putra, purchased approximately 9 million ISSP shares at IDR 264 per share on 22 April 2025, raising its ownership from 55.94% to 56.07%.

marketNews.title: U.S. and China to hold trade talks in Switzerland
marketNews.content: The ‚ÄúHot topics‚Äù section notes that U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer will travel to Switzerland this weekend for trade talks with Chinese Vice-Premier He Lifeng, the first officially confirmed bilateral trade talks, according to Bloomberg.

marketNews.title: India-Pakistan border clash escalates
marketNews.content: India launched an attack on Pakistan on Wednesday, 7 May, and Pakistan said it shot down five Indian fighter jets, marking the worst fighting in over two decades between the nuclear-armed neighbours. Pakistan said India triggered the clash after a militant attack on tourists in India‚Äôs Kashmir that killed 26 people the previous month.

marketNews.title: PBOC to cut 7-day reverse repo rate to 1.4% and lower RRR by 50 bps
marketNews.content: The People‚Äôs Bank of China announced on Wednesday, 7 May, that it will cut the 7-day reverse-repo rate from 1.5% to 1.4% on Thursday, 8 May, and will lower the required reserve ratio by 50 basis points the following week.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia seeks balance between inflation and growth as Q1 GDP slows
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia‚Äôs Director of Economic and Monetary Policy, Juli Budi Winantya, said on Wednesday that the central bank‚Äôs policy is to find an ‚Äúoptimal balance‚Äù between price stability and economic growth. His comments came two days after BPS reported Indonesia‚Äôs 1Q25 GDP grew 4.87% YoY, the weakest since 3Q21 but in line with the bank‚Äôs target range of 4.7-5.5% YoY for 2025. Reuters and Bloomberg surveys expect the central bank to cut the BI rate twice more to 5.25% by the end of 2025.

marketNews.title: Indonesia mandates seven coal mines to implement downstream projects
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources‚Äô Director General of Mining and Coal, Tri Winarno, said on Tuesday that seven coal mines with first-generation PKP2B licences ‚Äì PT Arutmin Indonesia, PT Kaltim Prima Coal (a BUMI subsidiary), Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AADI), PT Kideco Jaya Agung (Indika Energy‚Äôs subsidiary), PT Multi Harapan Utama, PT Tanito Harum (Harum Energy‚Äôs subsidiary), and PT Berau Coal ‚Äì must carry out coal-downstream projects. The total investment for the seven projects is estimated at about US$11.5 billion (‚âà IDR 188.7 trillion).

marketNews.title: Asian thermal-coal prices hit four-year low as Chinese imports slump
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that thermal-coal prices in Asia fell to a four-year low as imports from China, India and Japan fell. China‚Äôs April 2025 imports dropped 4.7% month-on-month to 22.72 million tonnes, a 13.1% year-on-year decline to 91.56 million tonnes, driven by lower coal-fired-plant usage and higher domestic production in China.

marketNews.title: Presidential Decree No. 46/2025 lowers local content requirement to 25%
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto issued Presidential Decree No. 46/2025 allowing the government to purchase goods with a minimum local content of 25%, down from the previous 40% threshold, and permitting purchases with lower local content when supply constraints exist.

marketNews.title: Seven EV makers commit IDR 15.4 trillion investment in Indonesia
marketNews.content: Investment Minister Rosan Roeslani said on Tuesday that seven electric-vehicle manufacturers ‚Äì BYD, Citroen, AION, Maxus, Geely, VinFast and VW ‚Äì have committed to invest a total of IDR 15.4 trillion in Indonesia, with a planned annual production capacity of 281,000 units.

marketNews.title: Bill Gates meets Indonesian President on health cooperation
marketNews.content: President Prabowo met with Bill Gates at the Merdeka Palace, Jakarta. The meeting discussed strategic cooperation in health to combat infectious diseases such as polio, tuberculosis and malaria. Gates said the Gates Foundation will launch a new anemia drug and a new TB vaccine in Indonesia in the coming years.

marketNews.title: Danantara to establish US$1 billion trust fund
marketNews.content: CEO of Danantara, Rosan Roeslani, said the company will set up a trust fund that could work with the Gates Foundation on education, health and poverty-alleviation, with a planned contribution of up to US$1 billion over the next five to six years.

tickerNews.title: MEDC gains 1.44% on oil-price rebound
tickerNews.content: MEDC shares rose 1.44% on Wednesday, May 7, after the oil-price rally; the move was part of a broader gain in oil-related stocks.

tickerNews.title: ENRG up 5.15% on oil-price rally
tickerNews.content: ENRG shares jumped 5.15% on Wednesday, May 7, as oil prices rose and demand outlook improved.

tickerNews.title: ELSA up 0.85% on oil-price rally
tickerNews.content: ELSA shares increased 0.85% on Wednesday, May 7, following the broader oil-price increase.

tickerNews.title: WINS gains 1.68% on oil-price rebound
tickerNews.content: WINS shares rose 1.68% on Wednesday, May 7, as oil prices recovered.

tickerNews.title: LEAD up 2.3% on oil-price rebound
tickerNews.content: LEAD shares climbed 2.3% on Wednesday, May 7, after the oil-price rebound.

tickerNews.title: Toyota acquisition of 40% of PT Astra Digital Mobil
Aster Chemicals to acquire Chevron Phillips Singapore Chemicals
tickerNews.content: Aster Chemicals and Energy will acquire Chevron Phillips Singapore Chemicals via its affiliate Chandra Asri Capital; transaction value not disclosed.

tickerNews.title: BRPT denies IPO plan for PT Griya Idola
tickerNews.content: Barito Pacific said it has no plan to launch an IPO for its subsidiary PT Griya Idola, refuting an Instagram rumor.

tickerNews.title: ANTM plans expansion into jewellery and custom products
tickerNews.content: Aneka Tambang announced a plan to add jewellery-type businesses, custom-product lines and other precious-metal laboratory ware, to be discussed at the 12 June 2025 shareholders‚Äô meeting.
